bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: In 1812 Elder Elnathan Finch, a resident, led in the organization of a Baptist Church. By 1815 the church had a log meeting house, although after a few years meetings were held frequently at a schoolhouse near the home of one of the members. Reverend Finch, who became the Society's first pastor was succeeded by Mr. William House, Ezra D. Owen, Jonathan Finch and John Ferris. The church and many members joined the Baptist Church at Branchport. The church was part of the Steuben Association.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Covenant meeting minutes (1812-1832) which contain receipt and dismissal of members; disciplinary cases, names of pastors and officers, appointments of representatives to association meetings and conferences; lists of members; an anti-masonry resolution' and the Church Covenant and Articles of Faith, 1812.
